content: hey my craft France I can't believe it's been over five years since i sat down
and sheepishly did my first video you know I wasn't sure what I was doing and
this kind of thing but I had a really cool idea I want to get out there and
you know I Hampton HOD and all this stuff and a whole look there's two those
first videos but I thought the ideas were so cool and so great and so cheap
then I wanted to get it out there and you know share this share this idea that
I had and wow it's just really sprung up you know so many people have taken up
the torch and have gone with it and gone in so many cool different directions and
we're all kind of you know with this great community of crafters and we're
all inspired by each other I think that's so fantastic you know I think
it's great that I'm not the only one that's producing this kind of content
and I you know I feel that I've inspired many people to go that may not have had
the courage to do their own channels to go out and make their own channel and
say see my stuff and say I can do that and I think that's great also that they
can see that what I would I make and say I can do that that was always my
intention my intention was to make it so that everybody feels like they can do
these crafts without being a you know an art student or whatever an art major and
that they're cheap that they're not that expensive to make because there's some
very expensive options for train so that was my goal and it's still my goal and I
I just I love it really as much as the day I started and I'm just so thankful
to have this community and you know the thing about the channel is you know I do
make a little bit of money off the advertising of the videos but it's never
going to be a big huge financial success right I'm never going to make a huge
amount of money off this it's really love that you know keeps me going and
making these videos and you know I just want to tell you guys that there are a
couple ways that you could help support the craft if you'd like you know I'm
never I'm not I'm not begging for money I'm not asking for money but if you
think what what you're seeing is a value and the community we have built up as
value then if you want to give something back
here's a couple ways you can do that one way is patreon and what you do is you
put on mount that you want to sponsor per video okay you can set your about
limit for the month also I only ever produce for I'm only going to produce
for craft videos per month at the maximum so you'll never have to pay more
than for craft videos a month and like I said you can set the maximum you want to
pay and there are several different levels on that if you do at least a
dollar level then you get extra content that I post every week for my patreon
Fran and you can go back to my feed and see all the stuff over a year now a
supply of extra stuff that I posted there like tips there like just sneak
peeks of stuff just all kinds of cool stuff that I like to show you guys but
it just it's really not enough for a whole video you know but it's enough for
just a cool little short video that I can show some cool stuff so that's one
way you can support the craft I've also done another thing where I've become an
Amazon affiliate and I've got a DM Scotty store and you can go there and
see the different craft materials and stuff I picked out also games like
Dungeons & Dragons and that kind of thing if you go to that to that store or
that link and you select something if you buy and I get a I get a small
commission fee but if you also if you just go there and then go buy something
else or buy other things I also get the commission fee for that so even if
you're not going to buy something from my store it still can help to support
the craft just by going to that page and then shopping from that page you know if
even if you don't buy anything on that page if you go to you know regular
Amazon and you start doing on that page then you will get then you will then I
will get the Commission so I want to just bring this to your guys attention
now I'll have the links in the video below for the patreon and the Amazon
store so I want to thank you guys for the support you know every little bit
helps me to improve my equipment get getting more craft supplies that I can
experiment on and that kind of thing so everything helps and I just want to
thank you guys and I really appreciate your support
go forth and craft and have a great time gaming and crafting
